channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2023101266
item.description:
Report X-2023101266

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered to be wet. Inspection revealed tape over cap loose with liquid leaked from loose cap and container leaked. DescribePack: Inspection revealed tape over cap loose with liquid leaked from loose cap and container leaked. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: proper clean up methods deployed.

item.title: Report X-2023101034
item.description:
Report X-2023101034

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed the large tear along the side of the box. DescribePack: Loose lid DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered it was placed inside a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2023100954
item.description:
Report X-2023100954

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded from the trailer and loaded onto a tugger cart. The package was then taken to the van lines and loaded underneath the belt. When the driver was loading his van he noticed the box was slightly wet on the corner and called for a manager. QA came and placed the box into a tote lined with a bag. The package was then taken to the QA cage damage area where the package was inspected. DescribePack: the caps on the top of each bottle was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The caps were tightened and the package was placed into a tote lined with a bag.

item.title: Report X-2023100470
item.description:
Report X-2023100470

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/8/2023 at approximatley 2000, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 5433639 at the ramp facility in Seattle, reporting a undeclared corrosive shipment. The shipment consistes 16 bottles of Carpet stair remover. The shipment discovered leaking during loading. A safety data sheet found online revealed that the contents is classified as UN3265. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulatoions, as it was without markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation from the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2023100806
item.description:
Report X-2023100806

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS USED BY RESPONDER AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023100608
item.description:
Report X-2023100608

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-30
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Once the trailer door was opened the package handler discovered the hazmat leaking. DescribePack: Package was crushed due to inadequate bracing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the box was placed in a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.
